meanings.definition: The territory or domain of an emperor.
meanings.sent1: The vast emperies stretched far and wide, showcasing the emperor's rule.
meanings.sent2: The emperies included lush forests, grand palaces, and bustling cities.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel claimed the backyard as his own emperies, ruling over the other animals.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and compassion created an emperies of love and harmony around her.
meanings.sent5: The emperies of the ocean held mysteries waiting to be discovered.

meanings.definition: The rank or office of an emperor.
meanings.sent1: He aspired to reach the emperies and lead with wisdom and strength.
meanings.sent2: The emperies demanded respect and authority from all who entered.
meanings.sent3: The costume party featured a comical emperies with a paper crown and a makeshift throne.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, she climbed the emperies through hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent5: The emperies of the classroom belonged to the teacher, guiding and instructing the students.

meanings.definition: The period of time during which a person or thing is dominant or powerful.
meanings.sent1: During his emperies, the king implemented many reforms for the benefit of his people.
meanings.sent2: The emperies of the ancient civilization saw great advancements in art and architecture.
meanings.sent3: The emperies of the toddler tantrum lasted only a few minutes before peace was restored.
meanings.sent4: In the emperies of winter, the snow-covered landscape transformed into a magical wonderland.
meanings.sent5: The emperies of the champion boxer inspired many young athletes to pursue their dreams.
